question: Among patients receiving red blood cell transfusions, does leukoreduction compared with non-leukoreduction reduce the incidence of post-transfusion infectious complications (e.g., serious nosocomial infections)? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Compared with the control period, the adjusted odds of death following leukoreduction were reduced (odds ratio [OR], 0.87; 95% confidence interval [CI], 0.75-0.99), but serious nosocomial infections did not decrease (adjusted OR, 0.97; 95% CI, 0.87-1.09).
content.source_2: The frequency of posttransfusion fevers did not decline after leukoreduction (adjusted OR, 1.02; 95% CI, 0.94-1.10), and antibiotic use rose modestly (adjusted OR, 1.12; 95% CI, 1.01-1.25).
content.source_3: CONCLUSION A national universal leukoreduction program was associated with decreased mortality and a significant reduction in serious nosocomial infections among high-risk red blood cell transfusion recipients.
